revised_title: Structure and Assembly of Bacteriophage #x3A6;29: Insights into Viral Genome and Capsid Formation
tldr: This article discusses the structure and assembly of bacteriophage #x3A6;29, a small and morphologically complex virus. The authors describe the capsid geometry, protein composition, and the role of specific genes in the assembly process. They propose that the capsid of #x3A6;29 is based on icosahedral symmetry and provide insights into how other viruses and complex biological structures may be assembled.
